transcript:
de-camp. Bonaparte riding over the battlefield had given final orders to strengthen the bat- teries firing at the Augesd Dam and was look- ing at the killed and wounded left on the field. 
"Fine men!" remarked Napoleon, looking at a dead Russian grenadier, who, with his face buried in the ground and a blackened nape, lay on his stomach with an already stiffened arm flung wide. 
"The ammunition for the guns in position is exhausted, Your Majesty," said an adjutant who had come from the bat
